ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English anoien, from Old French anoier (variant of enuier, meaning 'to weary, trouble'), ultimately tracing back to Latin inodiāre ('to make hateful'), derived from odium (hatred).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To cause slight irritation, vexation, or trouble to someone; to bother persistently.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 使（某人）烦恼；惹怒；打扰或骚扰。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ringing phone started to annoy him because he was trying to concentrate on his work.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那部响个不停的电话开始烦扰他，因为他正试图专心工作。
